title.narrative: She Leads Uganda:Enhancing the participation of GYW in decision making and social gender norms in Bugiri District

description.narrative: The project will engage Girls and Young Women (GYW) to meaningfully participate in decision making and addressing discriminatory social norms in Bugiri district.  It aims at increasing GYW participation in decision making and transformation of social norms, this aligns to She Leads program that recognizes the voices and participation of GYW as central. It also links the voices of GYW in Bugiri to the national level decision making processes
Expenditure 2021
Multi Community Based Development Initiative/ Q3 2021 IMP fu
Multi Community Based Development Initiative/Proj IMP funds
Multi Community Based Development Initiative/Proj Imp funds
Multi Community Based Development Initiative/qtr 2 2021 proj
Terre des Hommes Uganda/DPC audit fees she leads & ho projec

comment.narrative: Few male champions and local leaders qualified for transport facilitation during the community dialogue sessions.;

Over targets was due to more people reached to cover for target deficiencies in Q2 and low budget since there was an over expenditure in Q2 of 120 euros which when balanced the expenditure is on track.;
This was conducted and achieved in quarter 3.;

title.narrative: Number of GYW groups supported by She Leads partner organsations

description.narrative: Number of GYW groups supported by She Leads partner organsations

comment.narrative:
Over expenditure was due to facilitation of participants during the National Stakeholders' Dialogue and National Adolescent and Young People's Summit .
The overall budget was reallocated to facilitate National stakeholders dialogue meeting, Annual Adolescent and Young People's summit, 16 Days commemorations;
The budget variance was as a result of carrying forward the Orientation of GYW led Groups and Creating Safe Spaces from Quarter 2 to Quarter 3. The list of groups is part of the attachements;

The under payment was due to only 01 participated Out of the 05 GYW planned for National level engagements . Thus has been pushed to quarter 2.
7GYW groups have been mapped and formed in Q1 although the activity was planned for Q2.;

title.narrative: 20 National government official reached through through National celebration, planning and budgeting meetings at district and national level.(Parish, Subcounty, district and National level)

description.narrative: 20 National government official reached through through National celebration, planning and budgeting meetings at district and national level.(Parish, Subcounty, district and National level)

title.narrative: Number of national government officials reached by L&A on importance of GYW participation in political institution

description.narrative: Number of national government officials reached by L&A on importance of GYW participation in political institution

comment.narrative: The over expenditure was on the stakeholders facilitation during the meetings.;

The target variance was due to elimination of stakeholders who were previously engaged to avoid double counting. Over expenditure due to staff monthly airtime and sanitizers to support implement activities.;

The under expenditure was due to conducting only subcounty and parish level engagements and the district level did not happen because it was postponed by the district stakeholders. And also, the other International commemorations (Womens' day) at district was postponed to the day yet to be communicated. This has been pushed to quarter 2. 28 stakeholders both technical and political were reached through Advocacy engagement meetings, Community sensitization meetings and during the Child wellbeing committee meeting held in Nabukalu sub county.;

comment.narrative:
Due to restrictions on covid-19, only 89 community members have been reached with message on supporting GYW challenging negative social norms thus much has not been spent on the activity
The facilitation for the facilitators of the dialogue sessions was pending thus not reported in the financial reported it will be captured in the in the next report of Q3;

title.narrative: Number of L&A campaigns (including media) conducted

description.narrative: Number of L&A campaigns (including media) conducted

comment.narrative: During the quarter, much of the activities like orientation of media practitioners, printing of IEC materials, and radio talk shows had been carried forward from quarter 2 and have been done in quarter 3 thus the variances in the targets vs the actuals.;
The over expenditure was much of the activities like Production and airing of spot messages, Radio Talkshow and Printing of Posters and Stickers had been carried forward and thus implemented in Q4.;

The over expenditure was due to mobile money charges on facilitation for panelists during radio talkshow.
During the quarter, 1 radio station was engaged to conduct the quarterly radio talk show to disseminate information on positive gender norms.;

The reported cost is for radio talk show expenses. The low budget expenditure is to the costs of IEC Materials, planned talk shows/spot messages out of six month by June only two had be conducted and orientation which was halted due to Covid all these have been rescheduled to be completed in Q3;
